data.description: I will be starting my 100 days of code today and for day 1 and most of week 1, I will be setting up the react App to get this ready, Links to all commits will be here

data.challenge: Get the Design of this Site Working
data.description: Today I will be working with ReactJS, HTML, CSS, to get most of the starter material working for this challenge.
This site is now live on Firebase and it should be visible to everyone now!

data.challenge: Unit Testing Our Website using Jest and Enzyme
data.description: By the end of this week, I want to have this site fully ready, today we clean up the cards a little more and learn how to unit test using Jest and Enzyme

data.challenge: Build Data Structures in Python P1
data.description: Today I will be building all the data structures in python and create unit tests for all of these. This Will be split into multiple parts

data.challenge: Build Data Structures in Python P2
data.description: I finished implementing all the data structures in python and I will now start learning how to unit test properly with the unit test module.
Got Sick :(

data.challenge: Update Personal Website and Keep track of Fails
data.description: Today I will be updating my personal website and this site to contain my work. I will also be updating this site with a fail card since I didn't expect to fail so quickly.

data.challenge: Set Up Twitter Bot to keep track of Work P1
data.description: I began setting up a twitter Bot that will be posting everyday to keep track of my progress throughout the challenge. My goal is for it to post everyday whether I was successful in completing the challenge on time.
Today I went to a Cosmos DB conference to learn more about Azure so I decided to work on a basic REST API using Microsoft Azure. It is far from complete but I am excited to have it completed.
I have some coding challenges in a couple days so I decided to review some dp problems that leetcode says occurs often.
Have my Coding Challenge Tommorrow and I really want to be ready for dynamic programming questions since I tend to struggle with them. I have gotten a lot better with more practice but I feel ready!

So today I had a coding challenge and I decided to learn how to use PDB. PDB is the python debugger and I haven't gotten to use it much so I just used it on basic debugging of a uppercase all words in a string.
Today I decided to build some more automation for this challenge so I created a shell script to do some build, push, and deploy quickly.
Decided to work on some of the Top interview questions using c and c++, I will continue working on this soon.
Finished the Rest of the top commonly asked questions in C/C++. I learned a lot about polymorshism and other object oriented programming and I really want to learn more cpp.

data.challenge: Learn a little bit about Flask
data.description: Today I decided to start learning how to use Flask as a backend technology. I have a new project idea for Sudoku online which I will work on over the next few weeks.
I've got the sudoku board to generate with the solution to generate and now I am working on getting it to render on the page while changing the state independently.
I've started working on setting state of each input individually and I have begun to realize that it is trickier than I thought.
Today I realized, the day cards honestly look so disgusting and I really need to fix them. So we are going to make them look a lot prettier.
Started working on the design and implementing multi page applications with ReactJS.
I have an interview tomorrow and it's going to be using Vim. I have realized vscode has spoiled me so I need some practice.
Today I finally learned how to use useState and simplify functions a lot more and remove states with useState.

data.challenge: Use Sockets with Flask and React
data.description: Today I continued working with Sudoku and I decided to read up some more about flask and implemented a chat system for our react app.
Decided to spend a day focused more around reading content rather than coding but I learned about local storage caching which I hope to implement.
Decided I wanted a little break from Sudoku so I decided to start up a mini mongoDB tutorial. Should be done by tomorrow!
Got a working mongodb schema running and I learned a bit more about using express with Mongo. Definitely will be using this in the future.
Decided to implement the scss today and style things around the application so I can see changes a lot easier. Definitely wasn't feeling as motivated today. :/
